  • Extracapsular cataract removal with insertion of intraocular lens prosthesis (1 stage procedure), manual or mechanical technique (eg, irrigation and aspiration or phacoemulsification) (66984)

Risk and Consent

Risk Factors

ASA Physical Status

  • See anesthesia report

Informed Consent

  • Yes: Indications for surgical procedure, risks, benefits, possible complications explained to patient including alternatives in treatment. Patient had the chance to ask questions and all were answered to their satisfaction. Patient understood and gave consent.

Operative Findings

Operative Findings

  • No unusual findings

Preparation

Anesthesia

  • Monitored Anesthesia Care (MAC)
  • Topical

Position

  • Supine

Surgical Field

  • Operating microscope drawn into place

Draping

  • Prepped and draped in standard sterile fashion

Pre-medication

  • Not applicable

Operative Description

Extracapsular cataract removal with insertion of intraocular lens prosthesis (1 stage procedure), manual or mechanical technique (eg, irrigation and aspiration or phacoemulsification) (66984)

Laterality

  • Bilateral

Operation Description

  • Lieberman lid speculum placed between eyelids
  • Superior temporal incision performed in beveled three-stage maneuver
  • 3.0 mm keratome blade used
  • Watertight wound created
  • Intraocular nonpreserved lidocaine 0.2 cc used to complete anesthesia
  • Viscoelastic applied
  • Viscoelastic applied
  • Separate paracentesis site prepared in anticipation of two-handed phaco-technique
  • Continuous tear anterior capsulorrhexis performed with Utrata forceps
  • Hydrodissection completed
  • 30-gauge cannula used on a syringe with balanced salt solution
  • Phacoemulsification performed by chop technique
  • Viscoelastic reapplied to anterior chamber every 10 units of CDE for 10.41 total units of energy
  • I&A used to remove remaining cortex
  • Posterior capsule polished under low vacuum
  • Posterior capsule remained clear and intact
  • SN60WF intraocular lens of 22.5 diopters in power inserted
  • Lens inserted through 2.4 mm incision into capsular bag
  • Lens rotated to achieve stability and centration
  • Residual viscoelastic removed with irrigation-aspiration tip
  • Miostat used to constrict pupil and hydrate wounds
  • Vigamox 0.1 cc injected intracamerally
  • Wound checked and watertight
  • Vigamox and Timolol applied topically to eye
  • Gentamycin ophthalmic ointment applied
  • Lid speculum removed

Discharge and Condition

Estimated blood loss

  • 0 mL or less

Sponge/needle/instrument count

  • Correct x 2

Discharge

  • Home

Condition

  • Stable

DVT Prophylaxis

  • Not applicable

Specimen

  • None

Complications

  • No complications

Comments

  • Patient tolerated procedure well. Follow up in 48 hours Patient to resume preoperative eye drops and oral medications

Signature

  • Signed by Ophthalmology Surgery, MD at 10:55 AM Friday, March 22, 2013
